title: K of object as function of time

content.question: A <math alttext="2 kilograms " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object is released from rest near and above Earth’s surface such that the object-Earth system’s gravitational potential energy as a function of time is shown in the graph. Which of the following graphs represents the kinetic energy of the object as a function of time? Assume all frictional forces are considered to be negligible.

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 10, in increments of 5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Kinetic Energy, in Joules,” and the numbers 0 through 10,000, in increments of 2,000, are indicated. The curve starts at 0 second comma 0 Joule and moves up and to the right in a straight line to end at 10 seconds comma 10,000 Joules.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 10, in increments of 5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Kinetic Energy, in Joules,” and the numbers 0 through 10,000, in increments of 2,000, are indicated. The curve starts at 0 second comma 10,000 Joules and moves down and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply. The curve ends at 10 seconds comma 0 Joule.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 10, in increments of 5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Kinetic Energy, in Joules,” and the numbers 0 through 10,000, in increments of 2,000, are indicated. The curve starts at 0 second comma 0 Joule and moves up and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually. The curve ends at 10 seconds comma 10,000 Joules.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 10, in increments of 5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Kinetic Energy, in Joules,” and the numbers 0 through 10,000, in increments of 2,000, are indicated. The curve starts at 0 second comma 0 Joule and moves up and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply. The curve ends at 10 seconds comma 10,000 Joules.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 through 10, in increments of 5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Kinetic Energy, in Joules,” and the numbers 0 through 10,000, in increments of 2,000, are indicated. The curve starts at 0 second comma 0 Joule and moves up and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply. The curve ends at 10 seconds comma 10,000 Joules.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
